bibl.title: Making of Papyrus - An Ancient Biotechnology Or: Pliny was Right Indeed.
bibl.note: The microbiological data indicate that Pliny's description (XIII, 23, 77) of the process of papermaking from papyrus strips is absolutely correct. The treatment with muddy water from the Nile, i.e., with the microbial flora present there, conveys a much higher mechanical strength to the product.
bibl.seg: HÜTTERMANN A., M. FASTENRATH, A. KHARAZIPOUR and U. SCHINDEL, Making of Papyrus - An Ancient Biotechnology Or: Pliny was Right Indeed.

The microbiological data indicate that Pliny's description (XIII, 23, 77) of the process of papermaking from papyrus strips is absolutely correct. The treatment with muddy water from the Nile, i.e., with the microbial flora present there, conveys a much higher mechanical strength to the product.
